message:
Khoj is the annual treasure hunt organised by Azad Hall of Residence exclusively for freshers. It is the first campus wide event that is mainly about enjoyment and wining prizes while cycling long distances and getting to know your batch-mates and the beautiful campus of IIT Kharagpur.
This year's edition of Khoj will be on 3rd September. Be there at 5pm at Gymkhana.
#Khoj_16

Mid Semester Examination Time Table has been released. You can access the time table via ERP -> Academic -> Examination TimeTable -> Supplementary Examination TimeTable.
Best of luck for the exams beforehand !!

As a new initiative to promote innovation and entrepreneurship among IIT students the central government may soon launch a grant for scholarships worth Rs 60,000 per month for five years to students of Indian Institute of Technology (IITs). This step may prove to be a milestone in the startup culture in IITs. For further details one can visit the link given below. 

http://m.ndtv.com/profit/new-scholarships-for-iit-students-to-promote-innovation-1452040

From Thatched-Roof Mud Hut to Padma Shri via IIT Kharagpur : An Inspiration

The University of California and Los Angeles (UCLA) has decided to establish Mani L Bhaumik Institute for Theoretical Physics in recognition to his great contribution to the world of science. Mr. Bhaumik himself has donated 11 million USD for the center. The project which was sanctioned in June this year had its foundation stone laid on last Friday by the US Secretary of Education to the President Obama, Mr. John King.

Born into an extreme poor family in a remote interior village in Siuri (Erstwhile Medinipore, British India), Bhaumik had to walk 4 miles barefooted to reach his school. It was during the Great Bengal Famine of 1943 amidst the Quit India Movement when Bhaumik had to sleep for several days without dinner; that he became resolute in his fight against poverty. He went on to obtain his B.Sc followed by an M.Sc from the University of Calcutta. After the inception of IIT Kharagpur in 1951, he studied Resonant Electronic Energy Transfer in Quantum Physics here and was the first to be awarded a Ph.D degree at IIT Kharagpur. He further worked with the eminent Mathematical Physicist Satyendra Nath Bose (the same after whom the SN Bose Auditorium has been named) and has been doing extensive research work in the branches of Bose-Einstein Condensate Theory. He was awarded the prestigious Padma Shri in 2011 by the then President of the Republic of India, Smt. Pratibha Devisingh Patil. Besides wining numerous scientific awards, he is an eminent author both in Bengali and English, runs several academies for the poor and is a noted philanthropist.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur proudly congratulates Mr. Bhaumik for his achievements and wishes him a long and healthy life!

With inputs from The Time's Sunday Supplement (The New York Times) and UCLA Newsroom

From Thatched-Roof Mud Hut to Padma Shri via IIT Kharagpur : An Inspiration

The University of California and Los Angeles (UCLA) has decided to establish Mani L Bhaumik Institute for Theoretical Physics in recognition to his great contribution to the world of science. Mr. Bhaumik himself has donated 11 million USD for the center. The project which was sanctioned in June this year had its foundation stone laid on last Friday by the US Secretary of Education to the President Obama, Mr. John King.

Born into an extreme poor family in a remote interior village in Siuri (Erstwhile Medinipore, British India), Bhaumik had to walk 4 miles barefooted to reach his school. It was during the Great Bengal Famine of 1943 amidst the Quit India Movement when Bhaumik had to sleep for several days without dinner; that he became resolute in his fight against poverty. He went on to obtain his B.Sc followed by an M.Sc from the University of Calcutta. After the inception of IIT Kharagpur in 1951, he studied Resonant Electronic Energy Transfer in Quantum Physics here and was the first to be awarded a Ph.D degree at IIT Kharagpur. He further worked with the eminent Mathematical Physicist Satyendra Nath Bose (the same after whom the SN Bose Auditorium has been named) and has been doing extensive research work in the branches of Bose-Einstein Condensate Theory. He was awarded the prestigious Padma Shri in 2011 by the then President of the Republic of India, Smt. Pratibha Devisingh Patil. Besides wining numerous scientific awards, he is an eminent author both in Bengali and English, runs several academies for the poor and is a noted philanthropist.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur proudly congratulates Mr. Bhaumik for his achievements and wishes him a long and healthy life!

IIT Kharagpur will soon introduce an innovative new course that will involve researching the science behind happiness with an aim to develop "a happy eco-system".
The 'Rekhi Centre of Excellence for the Science of Happiness' is the brainchild of IIT-Kgp alumnus Satinder Singh Rekhi and will start by offering a micro-credit course for students from this autumn semester.
To read more you can follow the link given below.

http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/education/news/IIT-KGP-to-teach-science-behind-happiness/articleshow/53911561.cms

National Students’ Space Challenge (NSSC) has grown to be one of the prominent space-tech fests of the country. NSSC is a national level fest dedicated to the promotion of space technology in our country, held every year at IIT Kharagpur in association with the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO).
Date: 2nd - 4th September
Event schedule of NSSC'16 :

What an amazing and a nail biting end to the Open IIT Squash Tournament.
"Harsh Saraf beat Sagar Raj in a 5 set cliffhanger, 11-2, 11-3, 5-11, 9-11, 11-9 to successfully defend his title. Here are the final standings:

First position : Harsh Saraf ( Second Year,Patel Hall)
Second Position : Sagar Raj (Fifth Year, RP Hall)
Third Position : Manish Datta (Second Year, HJB Hall)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!!

AIESEC IIT Kharagpur in collaboration with Gopali Youth Welfare Society organized a cultural-sports event, ‘Balakalakaar’ for the students of Jagriti Vidya Mandir. JVM is a school where under-privileged students are taught free of cost and is entirely managed by GYWS, a student body in IIT Kharagpur. The event started off with an opening note by the president of AIESEC IIT Kharagpur, Mr. Vinayak Mahbubani in which he thanked the sponsors for the event namely Yes Bank, Syndicate Bank and the alumni network of AIESEC IIT Kharagpur. The drawing competition was the first event in which the students passionately expressed themselves by painting their thoughts on a sheet of paper. Some teachers participated too, and they impressed the judges with their work. The Interns from countries like Portugal, Malaysia, Germany, and Egypt were also present at this event and enthusiastically made some paintings reminiscing on their childhood. The drawing competition was followed by a sports competition which consisted of track field events of children like the balloon bursting, lemon race etc. Balakalakaar ended with a cultural event in which the tiny tots danced and made everyone exclaim at their cuteness. Here are some of the glimpses from the beautiful event.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.

The final version of CV module for placements will be opened tomorrow for data filling and CV generation.
Please save the current copies of your CVs (CV1, CV2, CV3) from the ERP for saving the data as the new version may remove some of your old data.
You will be able to enter the data by simply copying from the old CV.
                                                                      
                                                                    --Chairman, CDC

Please save the current copies of your CVs (CV1, CV2, CV3) from the ERP for saving the data as the new version may remove some of your old data.
You will be able to enter the data by simply copying from the old CV.

A Research paper by IIT Kharagpur has been published in the Royal Society of Chemistry Journal, Molecular BioSystems which says that Green Tea can help control Cataract.

The paper was published by Professor Swagata Dasgupta (Department of Chemistry) with her research team . Research scholar Susmitnarayan Chaudhury, the lead author,claims that an oxidant in green tea can prevent and delay the onset of cataract.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Professor Swagata Dasgupta and her entire team!!

http://www.hindustantimes.com/education/green-tea-can-control-cataract-says-iit-kharagpur-research/story-91Gu6HTYfo9Ub8ZgJNT36I.htmR

Placements is always a hot topic in the IITs.From the lavishing packages offered to the vast number of recruitments, a buzz is always there.
The fresh page in the story of placements is the ban on the 31 firms that went back on job offers by the IIT Placement Committee.The reasons for these companies getting blacklisted include revoking offer letters and delaying joining dates.Most of the barred companies are startups mainly.Healthcare startup Portea medical and Grofers are among the other companies barred.
Here is the link to the full story!
http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/IIT-placement-ban-on-31-firms-that-went-back-on-job-offers/articleshow/53865922.cms?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=TOI&from=mdr

Right from the announcement of the allotted halls to the last date of application for mutual hall swapping, students keep on coaxing, cajoling and persuading others to make them agree for hall swap. Students tend to prefer particular halls, whatever the reasons may be. This hall swapping saga goes on every year as usual. But this year it has been a different story. Mutual hall swapping was announced cancelled by the Hall Management Committee (HMC) a few days after the deadline for submission of forms. The reasons for the same aren’t clear. As per the sources, second-year undergraduate students don’t seem to be so happy with this decision. There has been a growing resentment among them. We as campus media body want to know what does the KGP student community think about this decision. So, we would like you to fill this form and make your voice rise!
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdaM2dB2fUAAB6QzTGQpJRAFM-Y1AcqZKzGFYnI0LxJmY0Dqw/viewform

Second Spot  - Saket Thavnani (Patel Hall)
Third Spot      - Abhishek Singhal (JCB Hall) 

Congratulations to the winners!!!

Open IIT Table Tennis tournament was organised yesterday under the tutelage of Technology Students Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. This event too saw a huge participation and players gave their everything to win their matches.
The results of the Open IIT Table Tennis Tournament are as follows: 
1st Reetam Roy (LBS Hall)
2nd Sourish Ghosh (LBS Hall)
3rd Anmol Basant (LLR Hall)
4th Sudarshan (LBS Hall)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners!

For the past few days, we have been seeing a growing trend of resentment amongst the students sitting for placements and internships regarding the newly introduced CV module for the auto-generation of Resumes by CDC. As a responsible media body, representing the common voice of student community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, conducted a survey regarding this new CV module and to the no amazement, we got responses from about 400 of the students who will be sitting in the upcoming placements. Here, we present to you the general issues faced by students with detailed infographics on the basis of collected data. Some specific problems addressed by the students have also been put forward in the article. Go on the below link for detailed analysis.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv.php

भाई की कलाई पर राखी का रेशमी बंधन प्रतिबिम्ब है भाई बहन के बीच के स्नेह और भरोसे का। आज हमारी एक बहन साक्षी मलिक ने रियो ओलंपिक में कांस्य पदक जीतकर जो इतिहास रचा  है, हमारी उम्मीद को सत्यता तक पहुँचाया है, उससे हम सब भारतवासियों का सर गर्व से ऊँचा हो गया है तो आइये आज हम सब  एकजुट होकर यह  स्नेह का धागा उनके नाम करते हैं  |
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से सभी को रक्षाबंधन की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं !!
#Rakhi_4_Sakshi

आई.आई.टी खड़गपुर के सभी विद्यार्थियों एवं शिक्षकगणों को 66वें स्थापना दिवस की ढेरों बधाईयाँ | 65 वर्ष पूर्व आज ही के दिन इस महान संस्थान का शिलान्यास मौलाना अबुल कलाम आज़ाद के हाथों हुआ था और आज ही के दिन उस उम्मीद का भी शिलान्यास हुआ था जो भारत को विज्ञान और तकनीक के माध्यम से दोबारा विश्व गुरु बना सकता है | जवाहरलाल नेहरू की उम्मीदों का हाथ थामे, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर, तीव्र इच्छा-शक्ति के साथ भारत निर्माण के दिशा में उठाया गया पहला कदम था | इसके बाद कई और आई.आई.टी. बनाये गए अर्थात इस दिन को सभी आई.आई.टियों का प्रातिबिंबीक स्थापना दिवस भी माना जा सकता है | 
आवाज़, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर इस शुभ अवसर पर उन सभी लोगों को अभिवादन करता है जिन्होंने औपचारिक अथवा अनौपचारिक तौर पर आई.आई.टी. केजीपी के निर्माण में योगदान दिया तथा आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर के सुगम भविष्य की कामना करता है |

Career Development Centre introduced a new system of CV generation for the Internships and Placements 2016-17 this year. Right from the inception, students have been facing many problems with this system and CDC has taken many timely inputs from the students and has made an ample number of changes in the system till date, but it is not up to the mark and the students are still struggling with this method. It has now reached the level of higher complexity. We have decided to take up this issue and we request the Placement Junta to participate in this survey and help us to raise this important issue as the deadline of registration is approaching fast (22nd Aug) . We'll be sending the analysis  of this survey to the concerned authorities for the necessary actions.
http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm5

The students of IIT Kharagpur have taken an initiative to celebrate Independence Day with the deprived children of village Soladhar, around 1.5 km from Prem Bazaar gate. Students collected fund themselves and visited villages to celebrate Independence Day with those children. 
This independence day, Students of IIT Kharagpur organized a Prabhat Pheri and encouraged villagers to join them. They unfurled flag, sung patriotic songs, cheered them for their performance and gave speeches to motivate to learn and be health conscious. Sweets, Fruits, Biscuits, Notebooks and pens were also distributed afterwards.
This social work has been undertaken by Hemant Singh,  Sushant Suman,  Ajay Kumar Singh, Deepak Verma, Amit Kumar Das, Tapasya Singh, Vishal Singh, Ashwinikant Tiwari, Yashwant Singh, Jagannath and some other students.
Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur wishes such attempts be taken on a regular basis for the benefits of the society.
